2a78e4ddb897d821d45a3ba9ce2078d5 (00:02): The workaround might be: write a servlet that removes the SSO cookie from the client's browser.

232512572096a4d8680305f759bef6c5 (00:06): You cannot logout as your username and password remain in browser memory until you exit. Hence, you must exit the browser to "logout".
2a78e4ddb897d821d45a3ba9ce2078d5 (00:07): lintlock: What kind of authentication are you using?  Basic?
76512b0957a0287ed49735fad98511fc (00:08): how can i register shutdown hooks ?
232512572096a4d8680305f759bef6c5 (00:09): sorry im a idiot jason b

2a78e4ddb897d821d45a3ba9ce2078d5 (00:09): lintlock: Well, then the behavior shouldn't be like that.. unless maybe you have your form manager turned on, and it saved your username and password for you, and any time it goes to that login page it auto-submits your username and password for you and logs you in.
76512b0957a0287ed49735fad98511fc (00:09): do i just use the normal way, Runtime.getRuntime().addShutdownHook(Runnable) ?

232512572096a4d8680305f759bef6c5 (00:10): Another advantage of form-based over basic authentication is that the application can programmatically close your authenticated session, enabling you to logout without restarting your browser.
